page.title: 08TRANSPORT PUBLIC & PRIVATE
page.content: The most convenient way to travel in our area is by car. Most families have a car. The nearest main road is the A9. The roads are single track with passing places from Dornoch to Embo and from Dornoch to Cyderhall. There is no direct rail service to Dornoch. The station used most by the local people is Ardgay which is 14 miles away. Highland Omnibuses run a sparce local service, but there is a daily fast bus service to Inverness. The Highland Region provides transport by bus or by taxi for many pupils from outlying areas to school in Dornoch. There is an unlicensed grass airstrip on the Dornoch Links. The biggest plane to land carries 14 passengers. Sometimes golfers arrive in small private aircraft to take part in golf tournaments. In 1986 work will start on a bridge across the Dornoch Firth.
